description: Continuing maintenance on the Nala health coaching project and beginning a master's thesis. Exploring cloud and systems research directions.
Tutoring students in debugging, project management, and exam prep. Hosting workshops on SSH and Git basics, developing lesson plans and coding exercises to reinforce core CS concepts.

Founded the university's 3rd CS club, mimicking a professional environment to give students real-world exposure. Teaching a React/Next.js/AWS stack to build software for local nonprofits. Conducting research on nonprofit tech utilization with a focus on AI applications in gerrymandering.

Collaborated with the Embedded Fastly team to optimize, scale, and test virtual CDN servers. Developed a Go-based API cache testing tool that integrates with cache nodes across deployment types, testing compute and observability components. Integrated the product into Fastly's CI/CD pipeline on a private Kubernetes cluster and built a Helm chart for deployment.

Built a talent and certification management tool with Microsoft Power Apps. Developed Power Automate flows to automate email notifications and Excel operations, reducing manual labor by 80%. Implemented security access control for 50+ employees and created app flowcharts, database schemas, and documentation.

role: B.S. Computer Science / M.S. Computer Science (4+1)
description: B.S. GPA: 3.64, M.S. GPA: 4.0. Coursework includes Data Structures & Algorithms, C & Systems Programming, Full-Stack Web Dev, Foundations of AI & ML, AI Redistricting, Computer Networks, and Software Development.
